block.p: 1. The oil by Grisha Brushkin, which sold in Moscow at the first international art auction in Soviet history, set a record for a work of contemporary Soviet art.

2. Amid concern that North Korean agents might try to disrupt the Olympic Games, President Roh Tae Woo of South Korea delivered an address to ''compatriots'' in both North and South Korea in which he announced steps to bring the two Koreas closer together.
3. Mr. Meese said his vindication was that the independent prosecutor, who filed the sealed report with a special panel of appellate judges, had not recommended criminal charges.
4. Governor Cuomo, who was responding to a dare from a journalist that he give reporting a try.

5. The sentence is one of the mnemonic devices to help people remember the value of pi - the ratio between the circumference and diameter of a circle. If the number of letters in each word is counted as a single digit, then the sentence reads: ''3.14159265358979,'' the approximate value of pi.

6. The day before the jetliner was shot down, two Iranian F-14 fighter planes, which were said to have emitted the same identification signals as those the Vincennes received as she monitored the Airbus, came as close as seven nautical miles to another American Navy ship.
7. The space shuttle Discovery was moved to the launching pad.
8. The United States was awarded the 1994 World Cup. As the host, it automatically qualifies for the tournament.
9. The Archbishop tried to win back certain Roman Catholics by holding the first traditional Latin Mass in Notre Dame in two decades.

10. The rule, which bans public corporations from issuing new classes of stock that would diminish the voting power of their existing shareholders, prevents executives from issuing stock with ''supervoting rights'' that give insiders leverage in proxy battles and takeover fights.
11. Justice Anthony M. Kennedy tipped the balance to the conservative side in some 5-to-4 votes.

12. Preliminary polling results suggested an unparalleled showing for two opposition parties, leading to speculation that the ruling International Revolutionary Party had been rejected by a larger proportion of the electorate than at any other time in its 59-year history.
13. The Soviet spacecraft is on a 400 million-mile journey to Phobos, a moon of Mars.
14. Largely as a result of acid rain, more than a quarter of the Adirondacks lakes and ponds are so tainted that the vast majority of them can no longer support fish.
15. Both men went on diets: Commissioner Ward lost 85 pounds and the Mayor lost only 11.
